alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 2:06PM MDT until June 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Crowheart, Kinnear...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to 8.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then slowly fall to 7.5 feet by this weekend. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
